message: Dear Bob, I am excited to present our premium product to you. After careful consideration, we propose a price of $1,350,000 for the product. We believe this price reflects its exceptional value and quality, while also providing a fair return for us. We look forward to your response.

Thank you for your offer, Alice. While I appreciate the value of your product, $1,350,000 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable with at this time.  I'm prepared to offer $1,250,000 for the product. I believe this price is fair and represents a significant investment on my part. I'm confident we can reach an agreement that benefits both of us.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. We appreciate your interest in our product. In light of your proposal, we would like to counter with a price of $1,300,000. This price still allows us to maintain a reasonable profit margin while acknowledging your budget constraints. We hope this revised offer meets your expectations and facilitates a mutually beneficial transaction.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $1,300,000 is still a bit more than I can comfortably afford right now.  I'm willing to go up to $1,275,000 for the product.  This is a fair price that acknowledges the value you're offering while also respecting my budget. I'm confident we can reach an agreement at this level.

Thank you for your latest proposal, Bob. We understand your financial considerations and appreciate your willingness to meet us halfway. In response, we are pleased to offer the product at a price of $1,295,000. This figure still allows us to achieve a satisfactory return on our investment, while remaining competitive in the market. We hope this counteroffer is acceptable and looks forward to your positive response.
